text: The heart that abides in Christ is a wellspring of joy and hope, overflowing with His goodness and mercy.
To abide in Christ is to dwell in His love and truth, finding eternal peace and joy in His presence.
To abide in the Lord is to know His heart, to be transformed by His love, and to live out His will.
Abide in the Spirit, and you shall receive wisdom and strength, for the Spirit leads those who remain in Him.
In abiding with God, you are anchored in His love, shielded from the storms of life and filled with His peace.
He who abides in God walks in the light and finds his path clear and steadfast.
The branches that abide in the vine are nourished and fruitful, bearing witness to the life of Christ within.
Abide in the teachings of Christ, and His truth will set you free, guiding you in all righteousness.
Abide in My Word, and you shall bear much fruit; apart from Me, you can do nothing.
Abide in the Lord, and He will abide in you; His presence will be a shelter and a source of strength.
Those who abide in God’s presence are like a tree planted by streams of water, flourishing and fruitful.
He who abides in God’s presence shall be renewed in strength and find peace that surpasses all understanding.
To abide in God’s love is to be transformed daily, reflecting His character and living in His light.
Abiding in Christ means living in His grace, and His grace is sufficient to meet every need and overcome every trial.
To abide in Christ is to walk in His steps, living out His commands and reflecting His love to the world.
In abiding with Christ, the soul finds its true home, and the heart is made complete in His love.
The Lord’s presence is a haven for those who abide in Him; His grace flows freely to those who remain close.
Abide in the Lord, and He will guide your steps, making straight your path and leading you in His way.
Abide in Christ, and His peace will guard your heart and mind, keeping you steadfast in every season.
In abiding with Christ, the faithful find unity and harmony, growing together in the fullness of His grace.
Faith is the pillar of the soul, the rock upon which the righteous build their trust in the Lord.
Faith is the song sung in the darkness, the melody of hope that echoes in the silence.
Faith is the bridge over troubled waters, the hand of God stretched out to those who would walk upon it.
In faith, the weak are made strong, the blind are made to see, and the lost are brought home.
Even in the wilderness of despair, the faithful find their way, for the Lord leads them by a pillar of light.
For faith is the seed that, though buried deep in the soil, rises to greet the sun in its due time.
When the night is long and the way is hard, faith is the flame that lights the path of the pilgrim.
Let your faith be as gold, purified by fire, shining bright in the presence of adversity.
As the eagle soars without fear, trusting in the unseen wind, so must man trust in the hand of the Lord.
The faithful heart shall never be shaken, for its foundation rests on the eternal promises of the Almighty.
In the furnace of trial, faith is refined as silver, and the heart of the faithful shines like the stars.
Let your faith be as a mountain, unmovable by the storms of doubt that surround you.
The man of faith shall walk through the fire and not be consumed, for the flames shall not overcome him.
Though the waves crash against the shore, the faith of the righteous stands firm, unyielding to the tide.
Faith does not wait for the sun to rise, for it knows the dawn is certain, even in the deepest night.
Faith is the breath of the soul, for without it, man is but dust blown by the winds of the earth.
As the tree reaches to the heavens, so shall your faith rise, drawing strength from the eternal waters.
When you cannot see the way, let faith guide your steps, for the path of the Lord is ever before you.
Faith is the shield that turns away the arrows of fear, and the sword that conquers the foe of doubt.
As the sparrow trusts the wind to carry it, so must the heart of man trust in the unseen hand of God.
Those who pursue holiness shall be filled with the peace of the Lord, for they walk in His ways and truth.
Holiness brings the presence of God into the life of the believer, filling them with joy and spiritual strength.
Holiness is the reflection of God’s purity in the heart; it sanctifies the soul and sets it apart for His purposes.
The call to holiness is a call to reflect God’s character, embracing His purity and living out His commands.
The path of holiness is narrow but leads to eternal joy; those who walk in it find peace and fulfillment.
In holiness, the believer finds true freedom, liberated from the chains of sin and empowered to live for God.
The Lord’s holiness is a guiding light for His people; those who follow it are led to righteousness and peace.
Holiness is the way to God’s heart, a journey that begins with repentance and continues in a life of devotion.
Holiness is the garment of the righteous, woven with threads of faith and adorned with the grace of the Almighty.
To be holy is to walk in the ways of the Lord, living a life that is dedicated to His service and glory.
To live in holiness is to be set apart from sin and dedicated to the Lord, walking in His light and truth.
To be holy is to live a life that is in harmony with God’s will, free from the corruption of sin.
In holiness, the faithful are set apart, living lives that honor the Lord and exemplify His divine attributes.
The Lord calls His people to holiness, for it is through holiness that they shine as lights in a darkened world.
Holiness is the fruit of a heart surrendered to God, producing a life of purity and devotion to His will.
The Lord’s holiness transforms those who seek it, making them vessels of His grace and instruments of His peace.
In holiness, the soul finds its true identity, reflecting the character of God and living in His divine purpose.
Holiness is the mark of a true believer, reflecting the light of Christ and the purity of His spirit.
The pursuit of holiness is the journey of a lifetime, leading to a deeper relationship with God and a life of eternal purpose.
Holiness is not achieved by deeds alone but by a heart transformed by the grace and love of God.
And the morning shall break with hope, for the hearts of the faithful are lifted by the hand of the Lord.
Hope is the song of the redeemed, sung in the quiet of the soul, heard by the angels of heaven.
Hope is the voice that whispers in silence, telling the weary heart, ‘Endure, for you shall overcome.’
In hope, the soul is anchored to the eternal rock, unshaken by the tempests of this life.
The faithful shall dwell in hope as a tree by the water, its roots deep in the promises of the Lord.
Hope is the seed planted in the soil of trust, watered by faith, and it shall bear the fruit of peace.
When the road is hard and the journey long, hope is the staff that upholds the weary traveler.
Even as the fig tree waits for its fruit, so does the hopeful soul wait for the fulfillment of all good things.
As the deer longs for water, so does the heart of man seek hope in the living God.
Hope, like the gentle rain, falls on the dry land of despair, bringing forth new life.
In hope, the foundations of faith are laid, and upon them rises the house of peace.
The sun sets upon despair, but in the dawn of hope, the righteous find their strength.
As the river flows toward the sea, so does hope guide the soul to the everlasting.
Though the night be long, the dawn of hope is assured by the eternal Word.
Let your hope be like the eagle’s wings, lifting you above the storms of the earth.
Hope shines in the eyes of the faithful, for they know the promises of the Lord are steadfast and true.
In the valley of doubt, raise your eyes to the mountain of hope, for there shall your deliverance be found.
Fear not the shadows of this world, for hope is the promise that the sun shall rise again.
Hope is a lamp unto your path, lighting the way even in the deepest night.
In the midst of the storm, hold fast to hope, for the light of the Almighty shall guide you through.
The joy of the Lord cannot be taken away, for it is a gift that endures beyond all trials.
The joy of the righteous is as a crown upon their heads, shining bright for all to see.
As the morning sun rises, so does the joy of the righteous, for their hope is in the Lord.
Sing for joy, O children of the Most High, for He has turned your mourning into gladness and your sorrow into dancing.
In joy, the heart finds its true home, for the Lord has prepared a place of gladness for those who trust in Him.
Rejoice in all seasons, for the Lord is near, and His joy shall be your strength.
Rejoice always, for the joy of the Lord is with you, and His grace surrounds you on every side.
Rejoice with those who rejoice, for in sharing joy, the love of God is made complete among you.
Those who sow in righteousness shall reap in joy, and their hearts will be satisfied in the goodness of the Lord.
The joy of the Lord is a river that never runs dry, refreshing the hearts of all who seek Him.
As rain falls upon the dry ground, so the joy of the Lord revives the weary soul.
In the presence of the Lord, there is fullness of joy, and at His right hand, pleasures forevermore.
Let joy be your song, even in the valley, for the Lord will lift you up and bring you to a place of peace.
The joy of the Lord is a fortress, shielding the heart from despair and filling it with peace.
Let your joy be rooted in the Lord, for in Him, your heart will find its greatest delight.
Though the path may be hard, joy is found in the Lord, who guides the steps of the faithful.
Lift up your voice in praise, for the Lord has filled your heart with joy, and His goodness endures forever.
The joy of the faithful is not shaken by trials, for their trust is in the Lord who holds all things in His hands.
Let your heart be glad in the Lord, for He has called you by name and filled you with everlasting joy.
Joy is the fruit of a thankful heart, and those who walk in gratitude shall be filled with the joy of the Lord.
The day of God’s judgment is a day of reckoning; it will set things right and restore balance to the world.
The judgment of the Lord is just and true; it discerns the thoughts and intentions of every heart.
The Lord’s judgment is a day of reckoning for all nations; it will reveal the true state of every heart and soul.
The day of the Lord’s judgment is a day of reckoning, where every deed is brought to light and every heart is revealed.
The judgment of God is a call to repentance; it challenges the heart to turn from sin and seek His grace.
In His judgment, God brings justice to the oppressed and delivers the faithful from the hands of the wicked.
In His judgment, God acts with mercy and justice; He remembers the plight of the innocent and punishes the guilty.
God’s judgment is both a warning and a promise; it warns of the consequences of sin and promises redemption to the penitent.
God’s judgment is both a warning and a call to righteousness; it urges all to turn from sin and live in His light.
God’s judgment is a light that reveals truth and righteousness, guiding the faithful to walk in His ways.
The Lord’s judgment is impartial, weighing the deeds of the righteous and the wicked with perfect fairness.
The Lord’s judgment is a testament to His holiness, upholding the standards of righteousness and truth in the world.
The Lord’s judgment is a purifying fire, cleansing the world of iniquity and establishing His reign of righteousness.
To fear the Lord is to respect His judgment; it is a reminder of His sovereignty and His righteous rule.
God’s judgment brings clarity, separating light from darkness and truth from falsehood with divine precision.
The Lord’s judgment comes with wisdom; it is a measure of His divine knowledge and understanding of all things.
The judgment of God is a reflection of His eternal principles, ensuring that righteousness prevails and sin is dealt with.
In the judgment of the Lord, justice is served; the wicked are punished, and the righteous are vindicated.
God’s judgment is a reflection of His holiness, purging sin and upholding His standards of righteousness.
In the judgment of the Lord, every secret is uncovered and every action is judged with perfect justice and mercy.
Just as a mother loves her child, so the Lord loves His people, never forgetting them, even in their wandering.
Blessed are those who love in word and in deed, for they reflect the heart of the Father, and His love is made complete in them.
The love of the Lord endures forever, and those who walk in His love shall never be forsaken.
He who loves not his neighbor knows not God, for love is the light that guides the righteous in the way.
Love is not boastful or proud, but humble and gentle, lifting others above oneself in the sight of the Lord.
He who loves has found the heart of God, for God is love, and all who dwell in love dwell in Him.
As the vine bears fruit through love, so shall your life bear much fruit when you abide in the love of the Lord.
Where love abounds, there is peace, and where the heart is full of love, the Lord dwells richly.
In love, there is no fear, for perfect love casts out all fear, and those who trust in love shall be at peace.
As the sun shines upon the earth, so does the love of God shine upon His people, warming even the coldest heart.
Let love be your anchor, and kindness your sail, for by these, you shall find your way to the Lord’s harbor.
The love of the righteous is like a flame that burns bright in the darkness, guiding the lost to the warmth of the Lord.
Let your love be sincere, without pretense, for the Lord looks upon the heart and rewards those who love in truth.
The love of the Lord is steadfast, reaching from generation to generation, to all who fear His name.
The love of God is a shield for the broken and a refuge for the weary, for in His love, we are made whole.
Love one another as I have loved you, for in this, the world shall know that you are My disciples.
Love your enemies, and pray for those who wrong you, for this is the way of the Lord’s perfect love.
No greater love has been shown than this: that one would lay down his life for his friends, and this the Lord has done for all.
Love is the greatest of all, for it covers a multitude of sins and binds the heart to the Father.
Let love be the root of all your deeds, for the fruit of love is eternal, and its reward never fades.
With a word, He cast out demons, and the afflicted were restored to peace, for His authority was over all things.
As the waves raged, He spoke, ‘Peace, be still,’ and the sea was calmed by His command.
In the wilderness, He fed the multitude with but a few loaves and fish, and all ate until they were filled.
At the wedding, He turned water into wine, and the joy of the feast was restored, for He revealed His glory in their midst.
When He commanded the evil spirits to depart, they fled at once, for His name was a terror to them.
And with a touch of His hand, the blind saw, and the people marveled at the power of God made manifest.
The blind man said, ‘I once was blind, but now I see,’ for the touch of Jesus opened his eyes.
And the woman who had suffered for twelve years touched the hem of His garment and was healed by her faith.
He broke the bread, and as He gave thanks, it multiplied in His hands, feeding thousands with what was little.
By His voice, the dead were raised, for even the grave could not hold those called by the Son of Man.
At His command, the storm ceased, and the winds obeyed, for the Creator of all things held dominion over nature.
When the nobleman’s son lay dying, Jesus spoke, and at that very hour, life was restored, though He was far away.
He cleansed the ten lepers, and only one returned to give thanks, showing the heart of gratitude amidst divine mercy.
When He touched the leper, his skin was made whole, and the crowds were astonished at the mercy shown to the outcast.
The deaf heard and the mute spoke, for no infirmity was beyond the healing touch of the Lord.
The sick touched Him, and power went forth from Him, healing all who came in faith, for the Lord’s mercy was endless.
The lame man walked at His word, and the people glorified the Lord, for never had such things been seen.
And when He walked upon the water, His disciples were filled with awe, for even the elements obeyed His will.
He healed the centurion’s servant from afar, for His power knew no bounds, and His word was enough.
And they brought unto Him the sick and the dying, and He healed them all, for His compassion knew no bounds.
Obey the Lord with a willing heart, and He will direct your steps and fulfill His purposes in your life.
Obedience to God’s Word brings peace to the soul and light to the path of those who follow His commands.
The Lord rewards those who walk in obedience, giving them peace and prosperity beyond measure.
Obedience is the fruit of a heart transformed by the grace of God, producing deeds of righteousness and love.
Obedience is the pathway to divine favor, leading the obedient to greater wisdom and understanding.
Obedience to God brings harmony and unity to the soul, aligning it with the divine purpose and grace.
The wise are those who hear the Word of God and obey it; their lives are built on a foundation that will not falter.
The path of obedience may be narrow, but it leads to the fullness of joy and the peace that surpasses understanding.
Obedience to God’s laws is a reflection of love for Him, showing that His Word dwells richly in the heart.
Obedience to the Lord is the path to righteousness, guiding the heart to walk in His ways and truth.
The Lord’s commands are not burdensome; they are a guide to a fulfilling and abundant life of obedience.
The blessings of the Lord are upon those who obey His commands and keep His statutes with a pure heart.
In times of trial, obedience is the key that unlocks the door to God’s deliverance and salvation.
He who walks in obedience shall find favor with the Lord, and His blessings will overflow in his life.
A heart that obeys the Lord is like a tree planted by streams of water, bearing fruit in its season.
The Lord delights in a heart that obeys His commands, for obedience is better than sacrifice.
A life of obedience to God’s will is a testament to His faithfulness and a witness to His power.
In obedience, the faithful find strength and courage, for the Lord stands with those who follow His ways.
Those who obey the Lord’s commands walk in His light and are shielded from the darkness that surrounds.
The faithful who obey God’s commandments shall not be moved, for their foundation is built on His promises.
And He spoke unto them in parables, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven is like a field sown with good seed, where the faithful reap in joy.’
He likened the kingdom of God to a net cast into the sea, gathering fish of every kind, for all are called to His light.
The parables are a mirror to the soul, reflecting the light of heaven to those who seek wisdom.
The unjust steward was wise in his dealings, but the children of light must be wiser still in the ways of their Father.
As the lost sheep is sought by the shepherd, so does the Son seek the lost, for He delights in their return.
As the vineyard was entrusted to the workers, so too has the Father entrusted the earth to those who serve with faith.
Jesus taught them in stories, for He knew the heart of man would understand the mysteries of heaven through simple things.
The wise man builds his house on the rock, said the Lord, for the foundation of faith shall never be shaken.
The wheat and the tares grow together, said He, until the harvest, when the righteous shall be gathered and the wicked cast away.
He said, ‘The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which though small, grows into the mightiest of trees.’
Through the parables, the Lord revealed the mysteries of the kingdom, that the meek and humble might understand.
As the sower casts seed upon the soil, so did Jesus speak His parables, planting truth in the hearts of those who would hear.
In patience, the faithful find strength; their endurance is a testament to their trust in the Lord’s timing.
The patient soul is like a tree planted by water, bearing fruit in its season, even in times of drought.
In the garden of patience, the seeds of faith are sown, and in time, they yield the fruits of righteousness.
The Lord honors the patient heart, rewarding those who persevere with blessings and a strengthened spirit.
In patience, we learn to trust; through trust, we experience the fullness of God’s grace and peace.
Patience leads to wisdom; those who wait on the Lord shall see His deliverance and rejoice in His salvation.
Patience is the companion of hope; it sustains the heart while it waits for the fulfillment of God’s promises.
Patience in the face of trials is a reflection of divine love, bringing forth character and hope in the believer.
Patience is a crown for the wise; it transforms trials into triumphs and brings peace to the soul.
To be patient is to be like the Lord, who is slow to anger and rich in mercy toward His people.
Patience is a virtue of the righteous; through it, they await the Lord’s promises with steadfast hope.
The Lord blesses those who are patient, for in their waiting, they find the fulfillment of His perfect will.
The faithful who exhibit patience are like a well-watered garden, thriving under the care of the Lord.
In the trials of life, patience is the key to peace; it allows the soul to rest in God’s unchanging love.
The Lord’s patience is boundless; He teaches His children to wait upon Him with a heart full of trust.
Patience is a sign of deep faith; it reflects a heart that rests in God’s promises and His perfect timing.
Through patience, the believer’s faith is tested and refined, producing a heart that trusts fully in the Lord’s will.
Patience is a virtue that prepares the heart to receive God’s blessings; it transforms waiting into a time of growth.
The steadfast heart, patient in adversity, is like a fortress, unshaken by the winds of trouble.
The patient heart endures through trials, knowing that God’s timing is always right and His plans are good.
With divine strength, God sustains the universe and upholds justice, His power is both gentle and fierce.
The power of God is a fortress, shielding those who trust in Him from the assaults of the enemy.
God’s power is a shield and a refuge, protecting the faithful from the snares and traps set by the wicked.
The strength of the Lord is a river of life, flowing with miracles and blessings for those who believe.
By the power of His hand, the mountains tremble, and the nations are brought to their knees before the Lord.
God’s power is revealed in His creation, in the changing seasons, and in the stars that declare His glory.
The power of the Lord is eternal, unchanging, and steadfast; His promises are as sure as His strength.
In the power of the Lord, the lame walk, the blind see, and the captives are set free.
No force can stand against the power of God; His might is supreme, and His dominion is everlasting.
The power of God is a beacon in the darkness, guiding those who are lost and showing them the path of righteousness.
The power of the Lord is like thunder from the heavens, shaking the earth and commanding the seas.
The Lord’s power is like a mighty wind, blowing through the valleys and lifting up those who are bowed down.
With a whisper, the Lord can calm the storm and with a word, He can create peace in the midst of chaos.
God’s power is unending and immeasurable; He speaks, and the universe is created, His word holds all things together.
In every trial, the power of God is present; His strength is made perfect in our weakness, and His grace is sufficient.
The power of God is the source of all creation; from the smallest seed to the vast expanse of the universe.
God’s power raises the dead and gives life to the lifeless; nothing is too hard for the Lord.
By His power, the Lord parts the seas and makes a way where there is no way, guiding His people with miracles.
By His mighty power, the Lord delivers the oppressed and breaks the chains of the bound, setting them free.
The Lord’s power heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds, His strength is made perfect in weakness.
He has set the captives free, and the chains of sin are broken by the power of His word.
The light of salvation shines brightest in the darkest of hearts, for none are beyond the reach of His grace.
He calls to the weary and the lost, ‘Come unto Me, and I will give you rest, for My yoke is light.’
To the sinner who repents, there is forgiveness, and to the lost who seek, there is salvation in His name.
Though our sins be as scarlet, they shall be made white as snow, for in Him is found forgiveness and peace.
He has called the broken to be made whole, and the lost to be found, for His mercy knows no end.
The Son has come to seek and save the lost, that all who believe in Him may have life eternal.
The righteous are saved not by their works, but by the grace of the Almighty, who shows mercy to all who believe.
No one who comes to the well of salvation shall leave thirsty, for the water He gives springs unto eternal life.
As the shepherd seeks the lost sheep, so does the Lord seek those who stray, and with joy, He carries them home.
In the day of trial, He shall be a shield to the humble, and a refuge to those who trust in His name.
Blessed are those who trust in the Lord, for they shall be saved from the pit and lifted into His everlasting arms.
The Lord’s mercy is like a river, flowing to all who thirst, and His grace like rain upon the parched land of the heart.
The Lord is the light of salvation, and none who walk in His ways shall stumble, for His hand shall guide them.
He who calls upon the name of the Lord shall be saved, and none who trust in Him shall be put to shame.
The path to salvation is found in surrender, for it is in giving our lives to Him that we are truly saved.
By His blood, we are cleansed, and through His love, we are redeemed, for He has paid the price for all.
Salvation is a gift, freely given, for none can earn what the Lord gives to those who seek Him with a pure heart.
Through faith, we are justified, and through love, we are restored, for the gift of salvation is offered to all.
For the gate is narrow, but those who walk in faith shall find life everlasting.
Though the night of suffering is long, the dawn of joy will surely come for those who trust in the Lord.
The sufferings of this world are momentary, but the glory of the Lord is eternal for those who endure with faith.
Blessed are those who endure suffering with patience, for they shall see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
The Lord has not abandoned you in your suffering, but is with you, shaping your heart for greater things.
Even in the midst of great suffering, the love of the Lord remains, and His compassion will carry you through.
The righteous suffer, but their hope remains in the Lord, and He will restore them in due time.
Let suffering be a teacher, for through it, you will gain wisdom and a deeper understanding of the Lord's purpose.
Even in the depths of suffering, the Lord's hand is not far, and He will lift you up when the time is right.
Suffering for a time brings forth perseverance, and perseverance leads to a faith that cannot be shaken.
Though you walk through the valley of suffering, know that the Lord walks beside you, guiding your every step.
Though suffering may be heavy, it cannot compare to the weight of glory that the Lord has prepared for His children.
In your suffering, cry out to the Lord, and He will hear your voice, delivering you from all your afflictions.
Do not be discouraged by your suffering, for the Lord strengthens the heart that clings to Him in times of trouble.
Suffering shall not last forever, for the Lord will wipe away every tear and heal the brokenhearted.
Endure suffering with a steadfast heart, for the Lord uses trials to purify and strengthen those He loves.
Let suffering draw you closer to the Lord, for in His presence, you will find peace amidst the storm.
In the furnace of affliction, the faithful are refined like gold, and their hearts grow stronger in the Lord.
The righteous may suffer, but their pain is not in vain, for the Lord will turn their sorrow into joy.
Though suffering may cloud your vision, trust in the Lord, for He is working all things together for your good.
In suffering, seek the Lord with all your heart, for He is your refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.
The fool speaks many words, yet gains no understanding; the wise speak few, yet their words are precious.
Folly’s road is wide and filled with laughter, but wisdom walks a narrow path with purpose.
The wise man listens in silence and learns, but the fool speaks loudly and gains nothing.
A wise heart seeks the knowledge of the Lord, but a fool scorns instruction and wanders aimlessly.
Wisdom builds her house with care, but folly tears it down with reckless hands.
Wisdom is a crown to the humble, but folly is a burden to the proud.
The fool despises wisdom’s rebuke and walks into the fire, but the wise take heed and turn away from danger.
A fool trusts in his own sight, but the wise seek counsel from the Lord and find their way.
The wise grow in understanding with each day, but the fool learns nothing, even from his failures.
The wise listen to counsel and walk in truth, but the fool closes his ears and stumbles into ruin.
Wisdom’s reward is peace and prosperity, but folly’s wages are strife and sorrow.
Folly dances in the streets, inviting all to join, but wisdom sits at the gates, waiting for those who seek her.
A wise man stores up knowledge for the future, but the fool spends his days in ignorance and regret.
Folly promises ease and pleasure, but her end is bitter, and her path leads to destruction.
Folly laughs at the rebuke of the wise, but wisdom delights in correction and grows stronger.
Wisdom guides the righteous on the path of life, but folly entices the wicked to destruction.
Folly basks in the light of pride, but wisdom finds her joy in humility.
The wise consider their steps, but the fool rushes forward without thought and falls into the pit.
A heart filled with wisdom is a treasure beyond gold, but folly leads to destruction and shame.
The fool builds his house upon the sand, but the wise lay their foundation upon the rock of truth.

Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God.
So we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
Jesus answered him, "If anyone loves me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.
Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in me.
I am the vine; you are the branches. Whoever abides in me and I in him, he it is that bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.
If you abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Abide in my love.

I have said these things to you, that in me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world."

Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness' sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven. Blessed are you when others revile you and persecute you and utter all kinds of evil against you falsely on my account. Rejoice and be glad, for your reward is great in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
For it has been granted to you that for the sake of Christ you should not only believe in him but also suffer for his sake,
It is good for me that I was afflicted, that I might learn your statutes.
Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the LORD delivers him out of them all.

Do not fear what you are about to suffer. Behold, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison, that you may be tested, and for ten days you will have tribulation. Be faithful unto death, and I will give you the crown of life.
More than that, we rejoice in our sufferings, knowing that suffering produces endurance, and endurance produces character, and character produces hope,
For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worth comparing with the glory that is to be revealed to us.
For the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
For the wisdom of this world is folly with God. For it is written, "He catches the wise in their craftiness,"
The wise person has his eyes in his head, but the fool walks in darkness. And yet I perceived that the same event happens to all of them.
For the protection of wisdom is like the protection of money, and the advantage of knowledge is that wisdom preserves the life of him who has it.
If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask God, who gives generously to all without reproach, and it will be given him.
Who is wise and understanding among you? By his good conduct let him show his works in the meekness of wisdom.

Everyone then who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock. And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house, but it did not fall, because it had been founded on the rock.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
The wise of heart will receive commandments, but a babbling fool will come to ruin.
When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with the humble is wisdom.
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to advice.
By insolence comes nothing but strife, but with those who take advice is wisdom.
There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way to death.
The fear of the LORD is instruction in wisdom, and humility comes before honor.
How much better to get wisdom than gold! To get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
The discerning sets his face toward wisdom, but the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
A fool takes no pleasure in understanding, but only in expressing his opinion.
Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.
The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and whatever you get, get insight.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.
